ygData.subject: Re: the spdat.eff conspiracy..
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I checked a screenshot of the Pestilence Scythe.  First of all, it has one _charge_ of Vamipiric Curse, it does not proc it.  Also, Vampiric Curse is (I
ygData.messageBody:
Grant Vanderhule wrote:
>
> From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>
> the reason i'm thinking this is a legitimate, hidden sk spell is thus: 1).
> we only get 6 spells at lvl 49, when every other spell circle we reach has 7
> spells. hmm. 2). there are equivalent spells for paladin and ranger: a lvl
> 49 ranger only spell, and a lvl 49 paladin only spell. the ranger spell
> seems to be a 200 point fire based DD, named "call of flame" or some such.
> the paladin one is named "divine might", and the effect is a bit confusing
> to read.. however, "embrace" is in there somewhere, so this might be a buff
> spell that adds a DD proc component to paladin's melee, ala VE without the
> drain. the stuff is IN there.. the problem is, is it actually implemented
> ingame or not? (beyond lifeleech being obviously in the pestilence scythe)
>

I checked a screenshot of the Pestilence Scythe. First of all, it
has one _charge_ of Vamipiric Curse, it does not proc it. Also,
Vampiric Curse is (I believe) a lifetap DOT, that gradually sucks life
out of something.

screenshot - http://gameznet.com/eq/equipment/ss/pestilencescythe.jpg

There may indeed be hidden spells for all hybrids, or maybe they were
in development and got dropped, but left in the file there. I wonder
if maybe they will be added to the Temple of Solusek as quest only
spells? As it stands, I couldn't find a single tank/hybrid in the
temple =(

Xilith
